it.polito.computervision.virtualscreen

Interface VirtualScreenInitializer

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractVirtualScreenInitializer, StaticVirtualScreenInitializer

    public interface VirtualScreenInitializer
    Classes implementing this interface will have to initialize the VirtualScreen parameters (namely size and depth). The initialization procedure could be either synchronous or asynchronous. If it's synchronous, the initialization must take place in the initialize(VirtualScreen, HandTracker, InitializerCallback) method, which must return true. Otherwise the initialize(VirtualScreen, HandTracker, InitializerCallback) method must return false immediatly, and when the init procedure has completed, VirtualScreenInitializer.InitializerCallback.initializationComplete(boolean) must be called from another thread in order to let the caller know the init procedure has completed.
    Author:
    giovanni

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Interface and Description
      static interface  VirtualScreenInitializer.InitializerCallback 

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean initialize(VirtualScreen vscreen, HandTracker tracker, VirtualScreenInitializer.InitializerCallback callback)
      Starts the VirtualScreen initialization procedure.

    • Method Detail

      • initialize

        boolean initialize(VirtualScreen vscreen,
                 HandTracker tracker,
                 VirtualScreenInitializer.InitializerCallback callback)
        Starts the VirtualScreen initialization procedure. This method should be called only once.
        Parameters:
        vscreen - (In/Out) the virtual screen that needs to be initialized
        tracker - The HandTracker
        callback - The object providing the VirtualScreenInitializer.InitializerCallback.initializationComplete(boolean) callback.
        Returns:
        true if this call is synchronous (the screen has been initialized in this call), false if it's asynchronous (the screen has not been initialized, and the callback will be used to notify its completion).
